Ingredients:

  • 1 kg pork belly, with skin
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons salt
  • 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
  • 2 bay leaves
  • Water, for boiling
  • Cooking oil, for frying
  • Vinegar, for serving
  • Mang Tomas or lechon sauce, for serving

Instructions:

  1. In a large pot, combine the pork belly, garlic, salt, ground black pepper, and bay leaves. Add enough water to cover the pork.

  2. Bring the pot to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to low. Simmer the pork belly for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the meat is tender.

  3. Remove the pork belly from the pot and let it cool for a few minutes. Pat the skin dry with a paper towel.

  4. In a deep pan or wok, heat cooking oil over medium heat. Add enough oil to submerge the pork belly.

  5. Carefully lower the pork belly into the hot oil, skin side down. Fry it until the skin becomes crispy and golden brown. This will take about 15-20 minutes.

  6. Turn the pork belly over and fry the meat side for another 10 minutes, or until it is nicely browned and cooked through.

  7. Remove the pork belly from the oil and let it drain on a wire rack or paper towels to remove excess oil.

  8. Let the Lechon Kawali rest for a few minutes, then chop it into serving-sized pieces.

  9. Serve the Lechon Kawali hot with vinegar or dipping sauce such as Mang Tomas or lechon sauce. It pairs well with steamed rice and a side of pickled vegetables.

Enjoy the crispy and succulent goodness of Lechon Kawali!
